title: Cache poisoning using NULL bytes and long URLs

profile.name: Greenhouse.io
profile.about: Software to optimize your entire recruiting and onboarding process.

activities.message: Just to add, you can see that the injected arbitrary string is still cached on the normal https://boards.greenhouse.io/embed/job_board/js?for=surveymonkey URL, which is not cached on the CDN layer if I make a request to another CloudFront IP address that is currently serving `boards.greenhouse.io` in the attached screenshot. This means that some lower-level cache will be serving the poisoned file to all users within the period of time that the cache is still valid.
activities.markdown_message: Just to add, you can see that the injected arbitrary string is still cached on the normal https://boards.greenhouse.io/embed/job_board/js?for=surveymonkey URL, which is not cached on the CDN layer if I make a request to another CloudFront IP address that is currently serving boards.greenhouse.io in the attached screenshot. This means that some lower-level cache will be serving the poisoned file to all users within the period of time that the cache is still valid.

activities.message: Thanks for the submission! We will attempt to validate this and will triage the issue once we have confirmed that it is a security issue.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for the submission! We will attempt to validate this and will triage the issue once we have confirmed that it is a security issue.

activities.markdown_message: Hi @lcvicknair, just wondering if there are any updates regarding this issue?

activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
Hi @lcvicknair, would you mind sharing what the fix was? I am still able to poison the cache by appending URL-encoded NULL bytes (`%00`), see https://boards.greenhouse.io/embed/job_board/js?for=surveymonkey and https://boards.greenhouse.io/embed/job_board/js?for=twilio.

Are you only limiting the length of the query string parameter?
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @lcvicknair, would you mind sharing what the fix was? I am still able to poison the cache by appending URL-encoded NULL bytes (%00), see https://boards.greenhouse.io/embed/job_board/js?for=surveymonkey and https://boards.greenhouse.io/embed/job_board/js?for=twilio.

Are you only limiting the length of the query string parameter?

activities.message: Hey @irvinlim ,the fix was indeed limiting the query string. Was there another way you were able to poison?
activities.markdown_message: Hey @irvinlim ,the fix was indeed limiting the query string. Was there another way you were able to poison?

activities.message:
I am still able to add null bytes and inject arbitrary strings into the resultant file. While the current approach probably is enough to prevent DoS for now, I thought that a better solution would have been to just prevent null bytes in the first place.

However if you believe the current approach is sufficient then I'm ok with it too, since it looks like the DoS is indeed prevented.
activities.markdown_message:
I am still able to add null bytes and inject arbitrary strings into the resultant file. While the current approach probably is enough to prevent DoS for now, I thought that a better solution would have been to just prevent null bytes in the first place.

However if you believe the current approach is sufficient then I'm ok with it too, since it looks like the DoS is indeed prevented.

activities.message:
Hi @irvinlim, 

Thanks for confirming. We have a followup card that will look into whitelist validation on the job board name. This change requires some more research on our part to make sure we aren't causing unexpected impact on customers. I will close this report and award a bounty since the immediate DoS risk was resolved. 

Thanks again for the report and validating the fix.
activities.markdown_message:

This change requires some more research on our part to make sure we aren't causing unexpected impact on customers. I will close this report and award a bounty since the immediate DoS risk was resolved.

Thanks again for the report and validating the fix.

activities.message: Hey @rongutierrez, I was wondering if I am able to get a user account for https://app.greenhouse.io so I could pentest it! I've been largely limited to testing publicly facing resources, hope you could consider my request!
activities.markdown_message: Hey @rongutierrez, I was wondering if I am able to get a user account for https://app.greenhouse.io so I could pentest it! I've been largely limited to testing publicly facing resources, hope you could consider my request!

activities.message: We don't allow security testing on our production environments. We have been discussing creating some sandbox environments containing test data for this purpose and opening it up to a small handful of H1 folks. This isn't available yet but we will keep you in mind if we get to that point.
